query: Is it possible to present my paper virtually at the main conference and the workshops, or to participate in the conference virtually?
output: Yes, it is possible to present your paper virtually at the main conference and the workshops, as well as participate in the conference virtually. The conference is designed to be a hybrid model facilitating both on-site and virtual presentations.

query: Who are given preference for the Travel and Accommodation Subsidies?

query: What is the selection criteria for the student volunteer program in ACL 2023?
output: The selection criteria for the student volunteer program in ACL 2023 involves evaluating applicants based on the material submitted in the application package. Preference will be given to students who are presenting a paper at the main conference or any of the associated workshops and do not have other means of travel support.

query: What is the social event on the third day of the conference?
output: The social event on the third day of the conference requires a name badge to access. It will take place at Steam Whistle Brewing / Canada’s Premium Beer from 7:00 PM - 10:30 PM on July 11th.

query: What is the scope of ACL reviewer awards?
output: The scope of the ACL reviewer awards is to recognize the contributions of reviewers for their outstanding and detailed reviews for the submissions to the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL) conferences and journals. The awards highlight the individuals who have provided the highest quality feedback and assessments based on thoroughness, usefulness, and accuracy in their evaluations.

query: Who are the Faculty Advisors for the Student Research Workshop at ACL2023?
output: The Faculty Advisors for the Student Research Workshop at ACL2023 are from the University of Michigan (USA) and University of Cambridge (UK). The advisor from University of Michigan can be reached at wangluxy@umich.edu and the advisor from University of Cambridge is Ivan Vulić, who can be reached at iv250@cam.ac.uk.

query: What is the introduction content regarding the ACL 2023 conference sponsors?
output: ACL 2023 is extremely grateful to all sponsors. We simply couldn’t run the conference without the help of these generous organizations. We thank them sincerely for their ongoing support of the NLP/CL community. If your organization would like to sponsor ACL or other conferences in the ACL family, please refer to our Invitation to Sponsors for information about sponsorship rates and benefits.

query: What are the time boundaries for early registration, late registration and on-site registration?
output: Early registration will end on Sunday, June 18, 2023, at 11:59 PM (EDT). Late registration starts Monday, June 19 and ends Friday, July 7, 2023, at 11:59 PM (EDT). On-site registration begins Saturday, July 8, 2023.

query: What are the potential topics of interest for the Industry Track at ACL 2023?
output: The potential topics of interest for the Industry Track at ACL 2023 include Best practices and lessons learned, Case studies from design to deployment, Implementation at speed, scale, and low-cost, and Negative results related to real-world applications. In addition, opinion or vision papers related to real-world applications are also welcome.

query: Can I apply for the conference registration waiver if I am presenting a paper and my registration fees are not covered by my organization?
output: Yes, you can apply for a conference registration waiver. In your application, you can justify your request by stating that you have an accepted paper for the conference and your registration fees are not funded by your organization or institution. However, you should not register for the conference until you hear back about your application for the waiver, as you would not be charged if the application is approved.

query: What is the policy on multiple submission for papers under review for EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023?
output: The policy allows an exception for papers under review for EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023. These papers can be submitted to ACL, but must be declared as such at submission time. If the work is accepted to EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023, it must be withdrawn from ACL by specific dates (January 31 for EACL 2023 and January 22 for ICLR 2023). These papers must also adhere to the anonymization policy of ACL 2023.

query: What should I do if I require caregiving expenses during the conference?
output: You should provide receipts for your caregiving expenses such as babysitting, transportation costs, or other support required for yourself or your dependents. These expenses can be reimbursed. If you need any personal or technical assistance to access and navigate the conference due to a disability, that can also be reimbursed. When applying for a caregiving and accessibility subsidy, you need to justify your application, for example, by stating that you would like to apply for a subsidy to take care of your child while you present your work at the conference.

query: What is the schedule for the conference and the workshops at the ACL 2023?
output: The ACL 2023 conference is scheduled from June 18, 2023 until July 14, 2023, with workshops happening on July 13-14, 2023. Specific events like a Lunch Break start at 15:30, some sessions start at 09:00 and end at 10:30, while another session that ends at 14:45. Another session is set to start at 16:00. Keynote speaker Alison Gopnik has a session scheduled within the conference as well.

query: Who are the Industry Track Chairs for the ACL 2023 conference and how to contact them?
output: The Industry Track Chairs for the ACL 2023 conference are Beata Beigman Klebanov from Educational Testing Service (USA), Sunayana Sitaram from Microsoft Research (India), and Jason Williams from Apple (USA). You can contact them through the email acl-2023-industry-track-pcs@googlegroups.com. Individual contact emails for Beata Beigman Klebanov is bbeigmanklebanov@ets.org. The contact information for Sunayana Sitaram and Jason Williams was not provided in the context.

query: What tasks may student volunteers be required to do for ACL 2023?
output: Tasks for student volunteers at ACL 2023 may include assisting at the registration desk, filling delegate packs, managing poster board sessions and displays, serving as volunteer coordinator for the day, and/or providing AV/technical support such as managing social media (specifically Twitter) and providing assistance for conference events including tutorials, the main conference, and workshops. These tasks could be for either online or in-person versions of the event.

query: What are some of the important deadlines for the ACL 2023 Industry Track?
output:
The important deadlines for the ACL 2023 Industry Track are as follows:

- Paper submission deadline: February 17, 2023
- Camera-ready version of papers due: May 29, 2023
- Main conference, including industry track: July 10-12, 2023

All deadlines are at 11:59PM UTC-12:00 (“anywhere on Earth”).

query: What are the requirements for the mandatory abstract submission?
output: The paper title, author names, contact details, and a brief abstract must be submitted electronically through the ACL 2023 paper submission site by the abstract submission deadline (January 13). Minor edits to the title and abstract can be made until the full paper submission deadline, but authors and subject areas cannot be changed. Submissions with “placeholder” abstracts will be removed without consideration. If the abstract submission deadline is missed, the full paper cannot be submitted.

query: What is the goal of the ACL 2023 Student Research Workshop?
output: The goal of the ACL 2023 Student Research Workshop is to bring together students investigating various areas of Computational Linguistics, Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning. It provides an excellent opportunity for participants to present their work and to receive mentorship and valuable feedback from the international research community. The workshop aims to aid students at multiple stages of their education, including undergraduate, MSc/MA, junior and senior PhD students, in getting familiar with conducting and presenting their research.

query: What is the Association for Computational Linguistics?
output: The Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL) is the premier international scientific and professional society for people working on computational problems involving human language, a field often referred to as either computational linguistics or natural language processing (NLP). The association was founded in 1962 and became the ACL in 1968. The activities of the ACL include the holding of an annual meeting each summer and the sponsoring of the journal Computational Linguistics, published by MIT Press.

query: Who are the intended recipients for Discounted/sliding scale virtual registration?
output: The intended recipients for Discounted/sliding scale virtual registration are researchers who otherwise would be unable to participate in the ACL events. The financial aid will be prioritized for those in greatest financial need and it is not intended for employed individuals and funded students from USA, Canada, Europe, Australia, New Zealand and higher income countries in Asia and the Middle East. Criteria for selection for financial aid will include country of residence, employment position, monthly income range, available financial support from your employer/university, and special circumstances.

query: What does the Full Conference In-person Registration Fee Include?
output: The Full Conference In-person Registration Fee includes admission to all in-person Meeting sessions and the exhibition as well as the entire virtual program, a conference bag and materials, tea and coffee breaks throughout the Meeting, admission to the Welcome Reception on Sunday 9th of July at The Westin Harbour Castle, Metropolitan Ballroom including light canapes and a welcome drink, admission to the Social Dinner on Tuesday 11th July at The Steam Whistle Brewer, including buffet dinner, and attendance to all recorded sessions on demand for at least one month following the Meeting.

query: What are the ethical considerations for paper submissions?
output: The ethical considerations for paper submissions include honoring the ethical code set out in the ACL Code of Ethics. Authors are required to include the Responsible NLP Research checklist with their submissions, which provides structured information about the ethics and reproducibility aspects of the study. The checklist should be considered from the early stages of the project and not as an afterthought. If there are concerns about the ethical aspects of a submission, it may be reviewed by the ACL ethics committee. Papers can be rejected on ethical grounds if the authors are judged to have acted counter to the code of ethics, or have inadequately addressed legitimate ethical concerns with their work.

query: Can I submit the same paper to another conference that is currently under review elsewhere (e.g. at EACL)?
output: Yes, you can submit the same paper to another conference like ACL that is currently under review elsewhere (e.g. at EACL) given certain conditions. You must withdraw the paper from the other conference within 24 hours of its acceptance notification. Additionally, you can submit a work under review for EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023 to ACL 2023, but this must be declared at submission time. If the work is accepted, it must be withdrawn from ACL no later than January 31 for EACL 2023 and no later than January 22 for ICLR 2023. Other than these specific situations, no other double submissions are allowed.

query: What are the guidelines about video submission for the system demonstration?
output: The video submission for the system demonstration should be a short, maximum 2 minutes long, video demonstrating the system. This video will be used to evaluate the paper, but it won't be published unless requested. A screencast with audio narration is a recommended choice for demos that can be presented on a screen. If not, a video of a user interacting with the system can be used. The production quality of the video is not of interest, and the videos are encouraged to be simply a screencast of the software that is getting demoed, with zero to minimal editing efforts. It is suggested that the video be published on YouTube or another website and include the link in the paper. If the screencast is not publicly uploaded, it needs to be in MPEG4 format and included as supplementary material with the paper submission via START.

query: What is the multiple submission policy of the ACL 2023?
output: The multiple submission policy of ACL 2023 states that any paper that is under review in a journal or another conference at the time of submission will not be considered. Submitted papers must also not be submitted elsewhere during the ACL 2023 review period. This policy covers all refereed and archival conferences, workshops, and ACL Rolling Reviews. Any paper that overlaps significantly in content or results with papers that will be (or have been) published elsewhere will also not be considered. If authors are submitting more than one paper to ACL 2023, they must ensure that their submissions do not overlap significantly in content or results. Identical or closely related work submitted to multiple ACL 2023 tracks will be treated as duplicate submissions and rejected. There is an exception for works under review for EACL 2023 or ICLR 2023, which can be submitted but must be declared at submission and withdrawn if accepted to either of the two conferences.

query: What is the anti-harassment policy at ACL events?
output: The anti-harassment policy at ACL events is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for all members and participants. Harassment and hostile behavior, including speech or behavior that intimidates, creates discomfort, or interferes with a person’s participation in an event, are unwelcome. This includes harassment based on attributes such as race, gender, religion, age, color, appearance, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Unacceptable behaviors include degrading verbal comments, deliberate intimidation, stalking, harassing photography or recording, inappropriate physical contact, and unwelcome sexual attention. The policy does not intend to inhibit scientific debate, but promote it by ensuring everyone is welcomed to participate. Those who experience harassment or hostile behavior may contact the Professional Conduct Committee, who will handle the case in strict confidence. Willful misuse of the procedure or vexatious complaints will be subject to sanctions.

query: What are the possible topics for discussion under the theme track 'Reality Check'?
output:
The possible topics for discussion under the theme track 'Reality Check' include: 
1. How reliably do the leaderboard scores translate to improvements in real-world use of the models?
2. How reliably do the leaderboard scores compare competing models?
3. While the current NLP systems are not brittle in the same way as their predecessors, they are still brittle in other ways. What tasks can we claim to have “solved”, if any?
4. Have performance improvements been accompanied by commensurate growth in the scientific understanding (of language, cognition, or deep learning technology)? In what ways?
5. Given that the authors of engineering papers are incentivized to report only the most successful results, especially for the systems that are also commercial products, what can the NLP venues do to improve reporting? 

Other areas include (non-)generalizability, (non-)reproducibility, evaluation, methodology, negative results, AI hype & expectations, science-vs-engineering, lessons from other fields and forgotten lessons.

query: What is the cancelation policy of the conference?
output:
The cancellation policy for the conference is as follows: 

- If the cancellation of registration is one month or more prior to the conference (June 09, 2023, or before), the full amount paid will be refunded but may be subject to a $50 processing fee.
- Cancellations up to three weeks prior to the conference (June 16, 2023) will be refunded the ACL membership (if paid as part of the registration) and any amounts paid over and above the first $200.
- Cancellations 2 weeks prior to the start of Conference (June 23, 2023), and all no-shows, will not be refunded any amount. However, they will be able to retain the current full year ACL membership (if paid as part of the registration) and have virtual access.
- Exceptions to these rules include: Cancellation due to governmental travel restrictions, failure to obtain a visa, or serious illness that prevents travel to the conference. In these cases, the full amount paid will be refunded (Minus up to $50 processing fee) regardless of when the notification is received by the ACL Office, provided that documentation supporting the cancellation exceptions is submitted.
